Question: Calculate the full payment required by Stephen as part of their agreement upon reaching the termination date specified above.

direct_answer.text: Stephen owes $7076683 initially and agrees to payback another 2% including accrued interests which amounts up to $(7076683*1.02)=$7217216. Therefore ,to clear off all loans through last instalment we need first subtract out these already paid installments from initial due amount.$(7217216-$300= $7214216)$. This new value represents what remains to still satisfy our agreed terms. 0.user_question: Stephen borrowed $7076683 from his sister and promised to return it with an additional 2% of the money he owed. For 11 months Stephen will give his sister $25 per month and the remaining amount, including the interest, will be paid on the twelfth month. How much will Stephen pay in the twelfth month?

1.subquestion: Find out how much extra 2% would cost Steven compared to what he already lent (7076683).

subanswer.text: To find the added 2%, multiply Steve’s debt ($7076683) by 2%. This equals $7076683 x 2% or about $141533.66. Answer: $141533.66.

ost_step.1: Add this extra cost onto the original sum that steve owes (the principal). That sums up to approximately $7076683 + $141533.66 which totals around $7218216.66.. Approximately $7218526.66 overall payment due when all twelve instalments complete their cycle....Answer: $7218526.66.
